page.title: 03TWINNING ASSOCIATIONS
page.content: Many places in Devon are 'twinned' with places in other countries, but particularly with France. Stokeinteignhead is twinned with Trevieres and Combeinteignhead is twinned with Osmanville. Both these villages are in Normandy. The twinning associations organize visits to their twin village, usually one a year. In the village hall at Stoke there is a charter hanging on the wall, written in both French and English which explains the purpose of twinning. In July l985 a group of children from Stokeinteignhead will visit Trevieres with the French children returning the visit in August. The twinning associations hold regular social and fund raising meetings to help pay for the expenses of the respective host village.
